en: And Moab rebelled against Israel after the death of Ahab.
hmr: Ahab thi hnung chun Moab ram chu Israel ram chunga chun a hel tah a.

en: And Ahaziah fell down through the lattice in his upper chamber that was in Samaria, and was sick: and he sent messengers, and said unto them, Go, inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, whether I shall recover of this sickness.
hmr: Chun, Ahazia chu Samaria khuoa um a in pindan chunghnung inhuonna dai âwngkâra chun a tlah a, a damnaw tah a; chun, tirtâwnhai a tir a, “Fe unla, Ekronhai Pathien Baal-zebub chu hi natnaa inthawk hin ka dam nâwk ding am va râwn ta u,” tiin.

en: But the angel of Jehovah said to Elijah the Tishbite, Arise, go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria, and say unto them, Is it because there is no God in Israel, that ye go to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Tisbe mi Elija kuoma chun LALPA vântirkoin, “Tho la, Samari lal tirtâwnhai chu intuokpui dingin fe rawh; chun, an kuoma chun, Israel rama hin Pathien a um ta naw leiin amanih Ekronhai pathien Baal-zebub chu râwn dinga in fe chu?

en: Now therefore thus saith Jehovah, Thou shalt not come down from the bed whither thou art gone up, but shalt surely die. And Elijah departed.
hmr: Tuhin, LALPA chun hieng hin a ti a nih, ‘Khum, i kainaa inthawk khan hung ṭum nâwk ta ngai dêr naw ti nih a, i thi ngei ngei ding a nih, a tih,’ tiin hril rawh,” a ta. Chun, Elija chu a fe tah a.

en: And the messengers returned unto him, and he said unto them, Why is it that ye are returned?
hmr: Chun, mitirhai chu a kuomah an hung kîr nâwk a, an kuomah, “Ieng- tiziea hung kîr nâwk am in nih a?” a lo tih a.

en: And they said unto him, There came up a man to meet us, and said unto us, Go, turn again unto the king that sent you, and say unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Is it because there is no God in Israel, that thou sendest to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron? therefore thou shalt not come down from the bed whither thou art gone up, but shalt surely die.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Mi pa- khat keini mîn tuokpui dingin a hung a, kan kuomah, ‘Fe unla, kîr nâwk unla, lal a tirtu cheu kuoma chun hieng hin va hril ro, LALPA chun hieng hin a hril a nih, Israel rama hin Pathien a um ta naw leiin am a ni Ekronhai pathien Baal-zebub chu thu indawn dinga mi i tir chu? Chulei- chun, khum i kainaa inthawk khan ṭum nâwk ta naw ti nih a, i thi ngei ngei ding a nih,’ tiin, ti rawh, a tih a,” an ta.

en: And he said unto them, What manner of man was he that came up to meet you, and told you these words?
hmr: Chun, an kuoma chun, “Nangni intuokpui dinga hung a, hieng thuhai hung hriltu cheu chu mi ieng ang hrim am a ni leh?” a ta.

en: And they answered him, He was a hairy man, and girt with a girdle of leather about his loins. And he said, It is Elijah the Tishbite.
hmr: Anni chun, “Ama chu sahmul puon sila, a kâwng chu kâwngkhia inhrên a nih,” an tih a, an dawn a. Chun, ama chun, “Elija, Tisbe mi kha a ni chu,” a ta.

en: Then the king sent unto him a captain of fifty with his fifty. And he went up to him: and, behold, he was sitting on the top of the hill. And he spake unto him, O man of God, the king hath said, Come down.
hmr: Chun, lal chun sipai sâwmnga pâwl hotu pakhat, a rawihai sâwm- nga le chun a tir tah a, chun, a kuoma chun a hang feh a, ngai ta, tlâng sîpa chun ama chu a lo ṭhung a. Chun, a kuomah, “Aw nang Pathien mi, lal chun, ‘Hung thla raw se,’ a ti che,” a ta.

en: And Elijah answered and said to the captain of fifty, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty. And there came down fire from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty.
hmr: Chun, Elija chun a dawn a, sipai sâwmnga pâwl hotu kuoma chun, “Pathien mi ka ni chun, vâna in- thawkin mei hung tla thla sienla, nang le i rawihai sâwmnga kha kânghâwp vawng raw se,” a ta. Chun, vâna inthawk chun mei a hung tla thlah a, ama le a rawihai sâwmnga chu a kânghâwp vawng tah a.

en: And again he sent unto him another captain of fifty with his fifty. And he answered and said unto him, O man of God, thus hath the king said, Come down quickly.
hmr: Chun, a kuoma chun sipai sâwmnga pâwl hotu dang le sâwmnga a tir nâwk a. Ama chu a hang feh a, a kuomah, “Aw nang Pathien mi, lal chun, ‘Hung thla raw se,’ a ti che,” a ta.

en: And Elijah answered and said unto them, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from heaven, and consume thee and thy fifty. And the fire of God came down from heaven, and consumed him and his fifty.
hmr: Chun, Elija chun a dawn a, an kuomah, “Pathien mi ka ni tak zet chun, vâna inthawkin mei hung tla thla sienla, nang le i rawihai sâwm- nga kha kânghâwp vawng raw se,” a ta. Chun vâna inthawk chun Pathien mei a hung tla thlah a, ama le a rawihai sâwmnga chu a kânghâwp vawng tah a.

en: And again he sent the captain of a third fifty with his fifty. And the third captain of fifty went up, and came and fell on his knees before Elijah, and besought him, and said unto him, O man of God, I pray thee, let my life, and the life of these fifty thy servants, be precious in thy sight.
hmr: Chun, sipai sâwmnga pâwl hotu le a rawihai sâwmnga ma a tir nâwk a. Chun, sâwmnga pâwl hotu pa- thumna chu a hang feh a, a hung a, Elija hmaa dingṭhaṭhuonin, a ngên a, a kuomah, “Aw Pathien mi, ka ngên che hi, keia hringna le hi i siehlaw sâwmngahai hringna hi i mithmua chun hlutak ni raw se;

en: Behold, there came fire down from heaven, and consumed the two former captains of fifty with their fifties; but now let my life be precious in thy sight.
hmr: ngai ta, vâna inthawkin mei a hung tla thla a, kha sâwmnga pâwl hotu pahnihai kha, an rawihai sâwm- ngahai leh a kânghâwp vawng tah a; amiruokchu, tuhin ka hringna chu i mithmua chun hlutak ni raw se,” a tih a.

en: And the angel of Jehovah said unto Elijah, Go down with him: be not afraid of him. And he arose, and went down with him unto the king.
hmr: Chun, LALPA vântirko chun Elija kuomah, “Ama kha zui thla la, ama kha ṭi naw rawh,” a ta. Chun, a tho a, ama chu a zui thlâk a, lal kuoma chun a fe tah a.

en: And he said unto him, Thus saith Jehovah, Forasmuch as thou hast sent messengers to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron, is it because there is no God in Israel to inquire of his word? therefore thou shalt not come down from the bed whither thou art gone up, but shalt surely die.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah, “LALPA chun hieng hin a ti a nih, ‘Ekronhai pa- thien Baal-zebub chu thu indawn dinga tirtâwnhai i lo tir hi, Israel rama hin Pathien rawn ding hrim an um naw lei a ni maw? chuleiin, khum i kainaa inthawk khan ṭum nâwk ta naw ti nih a, i thi ngei ngei ding a nih,’ tiin,” a ta.

en: So he died according to the word of Jehovah which Elijah had spoken. And Jehoram began to reign in his stead in the second year of Jehoram the son of Jehoshaphat king of Judah; because he had no son.
hmr: Chuongchun, Elijân LALPA thu a hril ang ngei chun ama chu a thi tah a. Chun, naupasal a nei naw leiin Juda lal Jehosaphat naupa Jehoram inlal kum hninaa chun Jehoram chun a aia chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaziah which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Chun, Ahazia thilthaw danghai a thaw tahai chu Israel lalhai inlal lai chanchin ziekna bua chun a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: Now Ahab had seventy sons in Samaria. And Jehu wrote letters, and sent to Samaria, unto the rulers of Jezreel, even the elders, and unto them that brought up the sons of Ahab, saying,
hmr: Ahab chun Samaria chun nau- pasal sâwmsari a nei a. Chun, Jehu chun Samaria Jezreel khaw hotu, upahai kuoma le Ahab nauhai lo enkawl tleituhai kuoma chun lekha a thawn a.

en: And now as soon as this letter cometh to you, seeing your master’s sons are with you, and there are with you chariots and horses, a fortified city also, and armor;
hmr: “Hi lekha hi in hmu phingleh, in pu nauhai chu in kuoma um an na; tawlailîrhai, sakawrhai, kulpui nei khuohai dâm, râlthuomhai khawm in nei a na;

en: look ye out the best and meetest of your master’s sons, and set him on his father’s throne, and fight for your master’s house.
hmr: chuongchun, in pu nauhai laia a ṭha tak le a fel tak zawng suok unla, a pa lal ṭhungphaah inṭhungtir unla, in pu sûnghai do chu dopui ro,” tiin.

en: But they were exceedingly afraid, and said, Behold, the two kings stood not before him: how then shall we stand?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni chun an ṭi ta êm êm el a, “Ngai ta u, lal pahni khawm khan an hne ta naw a na, einin iengtin am hne thei hlak ei ta?” an ta.

en: And he that was over the household, and he that was over the city, the elders also, and they that brought up the children, sent to Jehu, saying, We are thy servants, and will do all that thou shalt bid us; we will not make any man king: do thou that which is good in thine eyes.
hmr: Chun, lal in sûnga hotu tak dâm, khawpui awptuhai dâm, upahai le naupanghai lo enkawltuhai chun Jehu kuoma chun, “I siehlawhai kan nih, thaw dinga i mi hril ang phawt chun thaw pei kan tih; tukhawm lalah siem naw ning ung ah, nangin ṭha i ti ang angin thaw el rawh,” tiin mi an tir a.

en: Then he wrote a letter the second time to them, saying, If ye be on my side, and if ye will hearken unto my voice, take ye the heads of the men your master’s sons, and come to me to Jezreel by to-morrow this time. Now the king’s sons, being seventy persons, were with the great men of the city, who brought them up.
hmr: Chun, an kuomah, “Keia tienga ṭhang in na, ka thu in awi ding chun in pu naupasalhai lu hang la unla, zîngah hieng tik phât hin Jezreelah ka kuomah hung ro,” tiin lekha a thawn nâwk a. Lal naupasalhai chu sâwmsari an na, khawpui mi lienhai, anni enkawl tleituhai kuoma chun an um a.

en: And it came to pass, when the letter came to them, that they took the king’s sons, and slew them, even seventy persons, and put their heads in baskets, and sent them unto him to Jezreel.
hmr: Chun, lekha chu an hmu chun lal naupahai chu an man a, a sâwmsari chun an that a, an luhai chu bâwm- rângah an sieh a, Jezreel khuoah a kuomah an inphur tah a.

en: And there came a messenger, and told him, saying, They have brought the heads of the king’s sons. And he said, Lay ye them in two heaps at the entrance of the gate until the morning.
hmr: Chun, thangko a hung a, “Lal naupasalhai lu chu an hung lâk tah,” tiin a hril a. Chun, ama chu, “Kul lûtna kawtkhâr bulah hmun hniah intieng khâwm unla, zinga chen um raw se,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass in the morning, that he went out, and stood, and said to all the people, Ye are righteous: behold, I conspired against my master, and slew him; but who smote all these?
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun a va suok a, a ngîr a, mi po po kuoma chun, “Mi fel in nih; ngai ta u, ka pu chu ka phier rûk a, ka lo sukhlum ta luoh a; anleh, hienghai po po hi tu that am an nih a?

en: Know now that there shall fall unto the earth nothing of the word of Jehovah, which Jehovah spake concerning the house of Ahab: for Jehovah hath done that which he spake by his servant Elijah.
hmr: LALPA chun Ahab sûnghai chungchâng thu a hril a, LALPA thu chu hnuoi chunga hin luong hmang el naw ni ti hre ro; LALPAIN a siehlaw Elija hmanga a hril kha a hung suktlung a ni ta hi,” a ta.

en: So Jehu smote all that remained of the house of Ahab in Jezreel, and all his great men, and his familiar friends, and his priests, until he left him none remaining.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehu chu Jezreel khuoa Ahab sûnghai la um po po le, a mi lienhai po po le, a ruolhai po po le, a thiempuhai chu pakhat khawm hlapêk hlek loin a that fai vawng a.

en: And he arose and departed, and went to Samaria. And as he was at the shearing-house of the shepherds in the way,
hmr: Chun, a tho a, a suok a, Sama- riah a fe tah a. Chun, lampuia berâm- puhai berâm hmul vâwna hmun a va tlung chun,

en: Jehu met with the brethren of Ahaziah king of Judah, and said, Who are ye? And they answered, We are the brethren of Ahaziah: and we go down to salute the children of the king and the children of the queen.
hmr: Jehu chun Juda lal Ahazia unauhairawi a hmuh a, “Tuhai am in nih a?” a ta. Anni chun, “Ahazia unauhai kan na, lal nauhai le; lalnu nauhai chibai kan zu bûk ding a nih,” tiin an dawn a.

en: And he said, Take them alive. And they took them alive, and slew them at the pit of the shearing-house, even two and forty men; neither left he any of them.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “A hringin man tâwl ro,” a ta. Chuongchun, a hringin an man tâwl a, berâm hmul vâwna in khur bula chun an that a, mi sâwmli le pahni zet an nih, pakhat khawm an hla nawh.

en: And when he was departed thence, he lighted on Jehonadab the son of Rechab coming to meet him; and he saluted him, and said to him, Is thy heart right, as my heart is with thy heart? And Jehonadab answered, It is. If it be, give me thy hand. And he gave him his hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.
hmr: Chun, chutaka inthawka a suok hnung chun Rekab naupa Jehonadab, ama tuok dinga hung a va hmuh a; chuongchun, chibai a bûk a, a kuom- ah, “I chunga lungril indik ka put ang hin lungril indik i put ve am chu?” a ta. Jehonadab chun, “Put e,” tiin a dawn a. “Anleh i kut mi hang pe ta,” a ta. Chuongchun, a kut chu a hang pêk a; chun, ama chun a kuomah a tawlailîr sûngah a kei lût tah a.

en: And he said, Come with me, and see my zeal for Jehovah. So they made him ride in his chariot.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Ka kuomah hung ve la, LALPA ta dinga ṭhahnem ka ngaizie hi hang hmu ve hrim ta khai,” a ta. Chuongchun, a tawlailîra chun ân chuongtir ve tah a.

en: And when he came to Samaria, he smote all that remained unto Ahab in Samaria, till he had destroyed him, according to the word of Jehovah, which he spake to Elijah.
hmr: Chun, Samari a va tlung chun Ahab sûnghai Samaria la um sunhai chu a sukbohmang vawng hmakhat chun a that pei a, Elija kuoma a hril, LALPA thu ang ngei khan.

en: And Jehu gathered all the people together, and said unto them, Ahab served Baal a little; but Jehu will serve him much.
hmr: Chun, Jehu chun mipuihai po po chu a ko khâwm a, an kuoma chun, “Ahab khan Baal rawng hi a bâwl met chau a na, Jehu ruok hin chu nasa- takin a nih a bâwl ding chu.

en: Now therefore call unto me all the prophets of Baal, all his worshippers, and all his priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great sacrifice to do to Baal; whosoever shall be wanting, he shall not live. But Jehu did it in subtlety, to the intent that he might destroy the worshippers of Baal.
hmr: Chuongchun, Baal zâwlneihai po po le a betuhai po po le a thiem- puhai po po ka kuoma hin hung ko khâwm ta u; tukhawm a kim naw um naw raw se, Baal kuoma hin in- thâwina ropuitak inhlân ding ka nei a, tukhawm a kim naw taphawt chu hring dêr naw nih,” a ta. Nisien- lakhawm, Jehu chun Baal betuhai chu sukhlum tumin, var vervêkin a thaw a nih.

en: And Jehu said, Sanctify a solemn assembly for Baal. And they proclaimed it.
hmr: Chun, Jehu chun, “Baal hming- in ruoiṭhena ropui siem ro,” a ta. Chuongchun, chu chu an inthawn vêl tah a.

en: And Jehu sent through all Israel: and all the worshippers of Baal came, so that there was not a man left that came not. And they came into the house of Baal; and the house of Baal was filled from one end to another.
hmr: Chun, Jehu chun Israel ram po poah a thawn vêl a; chuongchun, Baal betuhai po po chu an hung a, ṭhang naw hrim hrim an um nawh. Chun, Baal ina chun an lût a; chun, Baal in chu kawtkhâra inthawka châwrtieng chenin an sip mup el a.

en: And he said unto him that was over the vestry, Bring forth vestments for all the worshippers of Baal. And he brought them forth vestments.
hmr: Chun, inthuomna puon enkawl- tu kuomah, “Baal betuhai po po hi inthuomna puon hung lapêk ro,” a ta. Chuongchun, inthuomna puonhai chu a hung lâkpêk a.

en: And Jehu went, and Jehonadab the son of Rechab, into the house of Baal; and he said unto the worshippers of Baal, Search, and look that there be here with you none of the servants of Jehovah, but the worshippers of Baal only.
hmr: Chun, Jehu chu Rekab naupa Jehonadab le chun Baal inah an lût a, Baal betuhai kuoma chu, “Hitaka hin Baal betuhai ti lo, LALPA mihai lo um ve rawi an tih, zawng unla, en vêl ta u,” a ta.

en: And they went in to offer sacrifices and burnt-offerings. Now Jehu had appointed him fourscore men without, and said, If any of the men whom I bring into your hands escape, he that letteth him go, his life shall be for the life of him.
hmr: Chun, inthâwinahai le pumraw- hmang thilinhlân inhlân dingin an lût a. Jehu chun tuola chun mi sâwm- riet a lo inngîr ta hrim a, “Hieng in kuta ka pêk ta cheu hi tukhawm an suok vai chun, ân suotu chun, a hringna aia chun ama hringna chu chân a tih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt-offering, that Jehu said to the guard and to the captains, Go in, and slay them; let none come forth. And they smote them with the edge of the sword; and the guard and the captains cast them out, and went to the city of the house of Baal.
hmr: Chun, pumrawhmang thilin- hlân chu ân hlân zo chun Jehu chun vêngtu sipai le an hotu kuoma chun, “Va lût unla, va that ro, tukhawm insuoktir naw ro,” a ta. Chun, kâwl- hnâmin an sât rak el a; chun, vêngtu sipai le an hotuhai chun an pei suok a; chun, Baal in umna khuoa chun an feh a.

en: And they brought forth the pillars that were in the house of Baal, and burned them.
hmr: Chun, Baal ina milimhai chu an lâksuok a, an rawh a.

en: And they brake down the pillar of Baal, and brake down the house of Baal, and made it a draught-house, unto this day.
hmr: Chun, Baal lungphun chu an sukchim a, Baal in chu an suksiet a, inhnâwmna inah an hmang tah a; tu chen hin an la hmang zing a nih.

en: Thus Jehu destroyed Baal out of Israel.
hmr: Chuong ang chun Jehu chun Baal chu Israel rama chun a suk- bohmang a nih.

en: Howbeit from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin, Jehu departed not from after them, to wit, the golden calves that were in Beth-el, and that were in Dan.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolna-Israelhai thil in- suksuoltira a thawhai chu Jehu chun a bân chuong nawh a; chu chu Bethel khuo le Dan khuoa rângkachak bâwngte lim biek a nih.

en: And Jehovah said unto Jehu, Because thou hast done well in executing that which is right in mine eyes, and hast done unto the house of Ahab according to all that was in my heart, thy sons of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Jehu kuomah, “Ka mittlungtaka thil i thaw lei le, ka lungril duthusâm angtaka Ahab sûnghai chunga i thaw leiin, i naupa- salhai chu suon li chenin Israel lalṭhungphaah ṭhung an tih,” a ta.

en: But Jehu took no heed to walk in the law of Jehovah, the God of Israel, with all his heart: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Jehu chun LALPA, Israelhai Pathien dân chu a lungril po poin a pawm nawh a; Jero- boamin Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a suksuol kha a bân chuong nawh a.

en: In those days Jehovah began to cut off from Israel: and Hazael smote them in all the borders of Israel;
hmr: Chuong lai chun LALPA chun Israelhai chu a thlauthlâk ṭan tah a; chuongchun, Hazael chun Israel ram po poa chun a hne pei a;

en: from the Jordan eastward, all the land of Gilead, the Gadites, and the Reubenites, and the Manassites, from Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, even Gilead and Bashan.
hmr: Jordana inthawka khawsak tieng, Gilead ram po po, Gadhai le, Reubenhai le, Manassehai dâm, Arnon ruoma Aroera inthawka Gilead le Basan ram tlung rakin.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all that he did, and all his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Jehu chanchin danghai, a thil- thaw po pohai, a thilthawtheizie po pohai chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Jehu slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Samaria. And Jehoahaz his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehu chu a pi le puhai kuoma chun a in tah a, Samari khuoah an phûm tah a. Chun, a naupa Jehoahaz chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And the time that Jehu reigned over Israel in Samaria was twenty and eight years.
hmr: Samari rama Israelhai chunga Jehu rorêl sûng chu kum sâwmhni le kum riet a nih.

en: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the seed royal.
hmr: Chun, Ahazia nu Athalia chun a naupa a thi ti a lo hriet chun, a tho a, lal nauhai po po chu a that vawng a.

en: But Jehosheba, the daughter of king Joram, sister of Ahaziah, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him away from among the king’s sons that were slain, even him and his nurse, and put them in the bedchamber; and they hid him from Athaliah, so that he was not slain;
hmr: Ahazia naupa Joas ruok chu lal Joram naunu, Ahazia farnu Jehoseba chun lal naupasal an thathai laia inthawk chun a ṭhuoi hmang a, a enkawltu leh khum pindanah ân umtir a. Athalia hmu thei lo dingin an thuphmang a; chuongchun, that a ni ve ta nawh a.

en: And he was with her hid in the house of Jehovah six years. And Athaliah reigned over the land.
hmr: Chun, ama chu amanu le chun LALPA inah kum ruk an inbihmang a, chuongchun, Athalia chun chu rama chun ro a rêl tah a.

en: And in the seventh year Jehoiada sent and fetched the captains over hundreds of the Carites and of the guard, and brought them to him into the house of Jehovah; and he made a covenant with them, and took an oath of them in the house of Jehovah, and showed them the king’s son.
hmr: Chun, a kum sarinaa chun Jehoiadain Kereth mihai le vêngtu sipaihai laia mi sipai za hotuhai chu ân kotir a, LALPA inah a kuomah ân ṭhuoi lûttir a; chun, an kuomah thu a thlung a, LALPA ina chun ṭawng ân khâmtir a; lal naupa chu ân entir tâwl a.

en: And he commanded them, saying, This is the thing that ye shall do: a third part of you, that come in on the sabbath, shall be keepers of the watch of the king’s house;
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “In thaw ding chu hieng ang hi a nih; nangni laia châwlnia hung dinghai hi hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khatin lal in chu vêng in ta;

en: and a third part shall be at the gate Sur; and a third part at the gate behind the guard: so shall ye keep the watch of the house, and be a barrier.
hmr: chun, hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat chu Sur kul kawtkhârah um in ta; chun, hmun thuma ṭhea hmun khat chu vêngtuhai hnungtienga kul kawtkhâra chun um in tih; chuong ang chun in chu vêng in ta, a dang- tuah in um ding a nih.

en: And the two companies of you, even all that go forth on the sabbath, shall keep the watch of the house of Jehovah about the king.
hmr: Chun, nangni laia pâwl hni, châwlnia ṭîn dinghai po po chun lal kâwl vêla LALPA in chu vêng in ta.

en: And ye shall compass the king round about, every man with his weapons in his hand; and he that cometh within the ranks, let him be slain: and be ye with the king when he goeth out, and when he cometh in.
hmr: Chun, mi tinin hriemhrei chawi- in lal chu inhuol vêl in ta; tukhawm huol sûnga hung lût taphawt chu lo that pei ding a nih; chuongchun, lal chu a lût le suok chu zui pei unla,” tiin thu a pêk a.

en: And the captains over hundreds did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded; and they took every man his men, those that were to come in on the sabbath, with those that were to go out on the sabbath, and came to Jehoiada the priest.
hmr: Chun, sipai za hotuhai chun thiempu Jehoiada thupêk ang po po chun an thaw vawng a; chun, mâni rawihai seng châwlnia hung dinghai le; châwlnia ṭîn dinghai chu an ṭhuoi a, thiempu Jehoiada kuomah an feh a.

en: And the priest delivered to the captains over hundreds the spears and shields that had been king David’s, which were in the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, thiempu chun sipai za hotuhai chu LALPA ina um, lal David fei le phawhai chu a pêk a.

en: And the guard stood, every man with his weapons in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, along by the altar and the house, by the king round about.
hmr: Chun, vêngtu sipaihai chun hriemhrei chawi sengin, in chang- tieng panga inthawk vawitieng chen- in, mâichâm le in hrûla chun lal chu an ngîr huol tuou a.

en: Then he brought out the king’s son, and put the crown upon him, and gave him the testimony; and they made him king, and anointed him; and they clapped their hands, and said, Long live the king.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal naupa chu a hung ṭhuoi suok a, lallukhum ân khumtir a, inhriettirna thu chu a pêk a, lalah an siem a, hriek an nâl a; chun, an kut an ben a, “Pathienin laltak humhim raw se,” an ta.

en: And when Athaliah heard the noise of the guard and of the people, she came to the people into the house of Jehovah:
hmr: Chun, vêngtu sipaihai le mipuihai ri chu Athaliain a lo hriet chun, LALPA ina mipuihai lai chun a va feh a;

en: and she looked, and, behold, the king stood by the pillar, as the manner was, and the captains and the trumpets by the king; and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew trumpets. Then Athaliah rent her clothes, and cried, Treason! treason!
hmr: chun, a hang en a, ngai ta, lal chu dân angin ban hrûla hin a lo ngîr a, sipai hotuhai le tawtawrâwt mûttuhai chu lal kâwlah an ngîr a; chun, chu rama mi po po chu an hlim êm êm a, tawtawrâwt dâm an mût an mût a. Chuongchun, Athalia chun a puonhai a keithlêr a, “Phier rûkna! Phier rûkna a ni tah ie,” tiin a khêk a.

en: And Jehoiada the priest commanded the captains of hundreds that were set over the host, and said unto them, Have her forth between the ranks; and him that followeth her slay with the sword. For the priest said, Let her not be slain in the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Jehoiada chun sipai chunga hotua ruot sipai za hotuhai chu thu a pêk a, an kuomah, “Sipaihai kâra khan amanu kha in- suoktir ro, tukhawm ama zui ta- phawt chu kâwlhnâma sât hlum ding nîng a tih,” a ta; thiempu chun, “LALPA ina chu that ding a ni nawh,” a lo ti ta sih a.

en: So they made way for her; and she went by the way of the horses’ entry to the king’s house: and there was she slain.
hmr: Chuongchun, lampui an inâwng a; chun, sakawr lûtna lampuiah lal inah a feh a; chutaka chun a nih an that chu.

en: And Jehoiada made a covenant between Jehovah and the king and the people, that they should be Jehovah’s people; between the king also and the people.
hmr: Chun, Jehoiada chun LALPA le lal le mipuihai kâra chun LALPA mihai an hung nina dingin thu a thlung tah a; lal le mipuihai kâra khawm chun.

en: And all the people of the land went to the house of Baal, and brake it down; his altars and his images brake they in pieces thoroughly, and slew Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars. And the priest appointed officers over the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, chu rama mi po pohai chu Baal inah an feh a, an sukchim a; a mâichâmhai le a limhai chu an suk- nâwi vawng a; Baal thiempu Mattan khawm chu mâichâm bulah an that a. Chun, thiempu chun LALPA in vêngtu hotuhai a ruot a.

en: And he took the captains over hundreds, and the Carites, and the guard, and all the people of the land; and they brought down the king from the house of Jehovah, and came by the way of the gate of the guard unto the king’s house. And he sat on the throne of the kings.
hmr: Chun, sipai za hotuhai, Kereth mi dâm, vêngtu sipaihai le, chu rama mi po po chu a ṭhuoi a, LALPA ina inthawkin lal chu an hung ṭhuoi thlâk a, vêngtuhai kawtkhâra lûtin lal ina chun an feh a. Chuongchun, lalhai lalṭhungphaa chun a ṭhung tah a.

en: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet. And Athaliah they had slain with the sword at the king’s house.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu rama mi po po chu an lâwm a, chun, khawpui chu buoi loin a um tah a; chun Athalia chu kâwlhnâmin lal inah an that a.

en: Jehoash was seven years old when he began to reign.
hmr: Jehoasin ro a rêl ṭan lai chun kum sari mi a nih.

en: In the seventh year of Jehu began Jehoash to reign; and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Zibiah of Beer-sheba.
hmr: Jehu kum sari ân lal kum chun Jehoas chu ân lal ṭan a; Jerusalem khuoah kum sâwmli ân lal a; a nu hming chu Zibia, Beer-seba khuoa mi a nih.

en: And Jehoash did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah all his days wherein Jehoiada the priest instructed him.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Jehoiadain Je- hoas chu ân chûktir sûng po chu LALPA mithmua thil ṭha a thaw hlak a.

en: Howbeit the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
hmr: Amiruokchu, bâwlhmunhai chu sukbohmang a ni chuong nawh; bâwl- hmunahai chun mihai chu an inthâwiin riminhnik an la raw zing tho a.

en: And Jehoash said to the priests, All the money of the hallowed things that is brought into the house of Jehovah, in current money, the money of the persons for whom each man is rated, and all the money that it cometh into any man’s heart to bring into the house of Jehovah,
hmr: Chun, Jehoas chun thiempuhai kuomah, “LALPA ina lâklût, thil ser intlanna sum po po tiem sa tahai laia fe taphawthai ta dinga tuk, an hring- na intlanna sum dâm, tukhawma LALPA ina lâk lût an phal sum po pohai chu,

en: let the priests take it to them, every man from his acquaintance; and they shall repair the breaches of the house, wheresoever any breach shall be found.
hmr: thiempuhaiin an hmêlhriethaia inthawkin lo la seng hai sienla, chuongchun, in sie, a sietna lai lai siem raw se,” a ta.

en: But it was so, that in the three and twentieth year of king Jehoash the priests had not repaired the breaches of the house.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, lal Jehoas chu kum sâwmhni le kum thum ân lal hnung khawmin thiempuhai chun in sie chu an la siem naw rawp a.

en: Then king Jehoash called for Jehoiada the priest, and for the other priests, and said unto them, Why repair ye not the breaches of the house? now therefore take no more money from your acquaintance, but deliver it for the breaches of the house.
hmr: Chuongchun, lal Jehoas chun thiempu Jehoiada le thiempu dang- hai chu a ko a, an kuomah, “Ieng- dinga in sietna laihai hi in siem naw am? Tuhin chu in hmêlhriethai laia inthawkin tangka chu la ta naw unla, in se siemna dingin pe suok lem ta ro,” a ta.

en: And the priests consented that they should take no more money from the people, neither repair the breaches of the house.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai chun mihai kuoma inthawka tangka lâk ta lo le, in sietna lai siemtu ni lo chu an remtih a.

en: But Jehoiada the priest took a chest, and bored a hole in the lid of it, and set it beside the altar, on the right side as one cometh into the house of Jehovah: and the priests that kept the threshold put therein all the money that was brought into the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Amiruokchu, thiempu Jehoiada chun bâwm a lâk a, a sîn a verpawp a, LALPA ina lût changtieng panga, mâichâm bula chun ân ṭhut a, chu- taka chun LALPA ina tangka hung lâklût po po chu kawtkhâr vêngtu thiempuhai chun an lo sie pei a.

en: And it was so, when they saw that there was much money in the chest, that the king’s scribe and the high priest came up, and they put up in bags and counted the money that was found in the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Chun, bâwma chun tangka a tam ta hle ti an hriet po leh lal lekhaziektu le thiempu laltak chu an hang feh a, an fûn a, LALPA ina tangka um zât chu an tiem a.

en: And they gave the money that was weighed out into the hands of them that did the work, that had the oversight of the house of Jehovah: and they paid it out to the carpenters and the builders, that wrought upon the house of Jehovah,
hmr: Chun, an tangka tiem chu sinthawhai, LALPA in bâwltuhai chunga hotuhai chu an pêk a; anni chun LALPA in bâwltu, themthiem- hai le in bâwltuhai hlawa dâm, lung suttuhai le, lung cho suoktuhai hlawa dâm;

en: and to the masons and the hewers of stone, and for buying timber and hewn stone to repair the breaches of the house of Jehovah, and for all that was laid out for the house to repair it.
hmr: LALPA in sietna lai siemna ding thinghai le lung sutnaa dâm, in siemna dinga a pawimawnaa pohai chun an hmang hlak a.

en: But there were not made for the house of Jehovah cups of silver, snuffers, basins, trumpets, any vessels of gold, or vessels of silver, of the money that was brought into the house of Jehovah;
hmr: Amiruokchu, LALPA in sûnga an tangka hung lâk chun LALPA in ta dinga tangkaruo nohai, khâwnvar puon chepnahai, maihûnhai, tawtaw- râwthai, rângkachak bûr le bêlhai, tangkaruo bûr le bêlhai an siem nawh a;

en: for they gave that to them that did the work, and repaired therewith the house of Jehovah.
hmr: sinthawtuhai an pêk hlak a; LALPA in siemna dingin an hmang lem a nih.

en: Moreover they reckoned not with the men, into whose hand they delivered the money to give to them that did the work; for they dealt faithfully.
hmr: Chun, sinthawtuhai an pêk dinga tangka an inkawltirhai khawm kha an enzuipui chuong nawh a, anni chun ringumtakin an thaw hlak sih a.

en: The money for the trespass-offerings, and the money for the sin-offerings, was not brought into the house of Jehovah: it was the priests’.
hmr: Bawsietna inthâwina thilin- hlân tangka le, suol inthâwina thilin- hlân tangkahai chu LALPA ina chun a lâklût nawh; thiempuhai chanpuol a nih.

en: Then Hazael king of Syria went up, and fought against Gath, and took it; and Hazael set his face to go up to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Suria lal Hazael chun Gath khuo a hang rûn a, a hang lâk a; chun, Hazael chu Jerusalema fe pei a tum a.

en: And Jehoash king of Judah took all the hallowed things that Jehoshaphat and Jehoram and Ahaziah, his fathers, kings of Judah, had dedicated, and his own hallowed things, and all the gold that was found in the treasures of the house of Jehovah, and of the king’s house, and sent it to Hazael king of Syria: and he went away from Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Juda lal Jehoas chun Juda lal a puhai Jehosaphat hai dâm, Jehoram hai dâm, Ahazia hai dâm, lo inhlân tah thil serhai po po le, ama thil serhai le LALPA ina mi le lal ina ro siekhâwmnaa mi rângkachak um po pohai chu a lâk vawng a; Suria lal Hazael chu a thawn a; chuongchun, Jerusalem chu a nghatsan nâwk tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
hmr: Chuongchun, Joas chanchin danghai, a thilthawhai po po chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And his servants arose, and made a conspiracy, and smote Joash at the house of Millo, on the way that goeth down to Silla.
hmr: Chun, a mihai chu an tho a, ama an phier rûk a, Joas chu Silla pan thlâkna lampuiah Millo inah an thawh a, an sukhlum a.

en: For Jozacar the son of Shimeath, and Jehozabad the son of Shomer, his servants, smote him, and he died; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David: and Amaziah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Ama mi Shimeath naupa Zozakar le Somer naupa Jehozabad chun an that a nih; chuongchun, a pi le puhai lai David khawpuia chun an phûm a; chun, a naupa Amazia chu a aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: In the three and twentieth year of Joash the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz the son of Jehu began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned seventeen years.
hmr: Juda lal Ahazia naupa Joas kum sâwm hni le kum thum ân lal kum chun Jehu naupa Jehoahaz chu Israelhai chungah Samari khuoa chun ân lal ṭan a, kum sâwm le kum sari ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, and followed the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin; he departed not therefrom.
hmr: LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a, Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a thaw Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolnahai kha a chîng veh a, a mâksan nâwk ta hrim hrim nawh a.

en: And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Israel, and he delivered them into the hand of Hazael king of Syria, and into the hand of Ben-hadad the son of Hazael, continually.
hmr: Chun, LALPA lung chu Israelhai chunga chun a chawk a, chuongchun, Suria lal Hazael kuta le, Hazael naupa Benhadad kuta chun a pêk ta pei a.

en: And Jehoahaz besought Jehovah, and Jehovah hearkened unto him; for he saw the oppression of Israel, how that the king of Syria oppressed them.
hmr: Chun, Jehoahaz chun LALPA kuomah a ngên a ngên a; chun, LALPAIN a thu chu a lo ngaipêk a, Israelhai nêksâwra an um a, Suria lalin anni a nêksâwrzie chu a hmu zing sih a.

en: (And Jehovah gave Israel a saviour, so that they went out from under the hand of the Syrians; and the children of Israel dwelt in their tents as beforetime.
hmr: LALPA chun Israelhai chu san- damtu a pêk a; chuongchun, Suria mihai hnuoia an um chu an suok a, Israel thlahai chu kha hma ang bawk khan anni in tieng an um nâwk ta ṭawk ṭawk a.

en: Nevertheless they departed not from the sins of the house of Jeroboam, wherewith he made Israel to sin, but walked therein: and there remained the Asherah also in Samaria.)
hmr: Amiruokchu, Israelhai thil in- suksuoltira a thaw Jeroboam sûnghai suolna kha an mâksan nawh a; an la chîng ta zing lem a; chun, Samari khuoa chun Asera khawm chu a la um zing nghe nghe a.

en: For he left not to Jehoahaz of the people save fifty horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the king of Syria destroyed them, and made them like the dust in threshing.
hmr: Jehoahaz chu a mihai laia sakawr chung chuong mi sâwmnga le tawlailîr sâwm le, sipai sîng khat ti naw chu nei a phalpêk si nawh a, Suria lal chun a sukbohmang vawng a, pilvut childip ang elin a siem a nih.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his might, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehoahaz chanchin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai, a thil- thawtheizie dâm chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua chun a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Jehoahaz slept with his fathers; and they buried him in Samaria: and Joash his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Jehoahaz chu a pi le puhai kuomah a in tah a; chun, Samari khuoa chun an phûm a; chun, a naupa Joas chu a aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: In the thirty and seventh year of Joash king of Judah began Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned sixteen years.
hmr: Juda lal Joas kum sâwmthum le kum sari ân lal kum chun Jehoahaz naupa Jehoas chu Israelhai chungah Samari khuoah ân lal ṭan a; kum sâwm le kum ruk ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah; he departed not from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin; but he walked therein.
hmr: Chun, LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a; Israel hai thil insuksuoltira a thaw Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolnahai po po kha a mâksan bîk nawh a, a la chîng zing ta lem a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Joash, and all that he did, and his might wherewith he fought against Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Chuongchun, Joas chanchin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai dâm, Juda lal Amazia a thaw laia a thil- thawtheizie dâm chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua chun a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Joash slept with his fathers; and Jeroboam sat upon his throne: and Joash was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Joas chu a pi le puhai kuomah a in tah a; chun Jeroboam chu a lal ṭhungphaah a ṭhung a, chun Joas chu Samari khuoah Israel lalhai lai an phûm tah a.

en: Now Elisha was fallen sick of his sickness whereof he died: and Joash the king of Israel came down unto him, and wept over him, and said, My father, my father, the chariots of Israel and the horsemen thereof!
hmr: Chun, Elisa chu a thipui ding natnain a hung na tah a, chuongchun, Israel lal Joas chu a kuomah a zu feh a, a ṭah a, “Pa, Pa, Israelhai tawlailîr le sakawr chung chuong mihai,” a ta;

en: And Elisha said unto him, Take bow and arrows; and he took unto him bow and arrows.
hmr: Chun, Elisa chun a kuomah “Thalngul le thalhai hung la ta,” a ta; chun, thalngul le thalhai a hung lâk a.

en: And he said to the king of Israel, Put thy hand upon the bow; and he put his hand upon it. And Elisha laid his hands upon the king’s hands.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal kuoma chun, “Thalngul kha hang chel ta,” a tih a, chuongchun, a hang chel a. Chun, Elisa chun lal kut chunga chun a kut ân nghat a.

en: And he said, Open the window eastward; and he opened it. Then Elisha said, Shoot; and he shot. And he said, Jehovah’s arrow of victory, even the arrow of victory over Syria; for thou shalt smite the Syrians in Aphek, till thou have consumed them.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Saktieng tukver hang hawng ta,” a ta, chun, a hang hawng a. Chun, Elisa chun, “Kâp rawh,” a ta, chun, a hang kâp a, chun, ama chun, “LALPA hnena thal, Suriahai hnena thal a ni kha; Aphek khuoa chun Suria mihai chu bo- hmang dêr khawpin i hne ding annâwm,” a ta.

en: And he said, Take the arrows; and he took them. And he said unto the king of Israel, Smite upon the ground; and he smote thrice, and stayed.
hmr: Chun, “Thalhai kha hung la ta,” a ti nâwk a; chuongchun, a hei lâk a. Chun, Israel lal kuoma chun, “Hnuoi kha hei sun ta,” a ta; chuongchun, vawi thum a hei sun a, a ma ta el a.

en: And the man of God was wroth with him, and said, Thou shouldest have smitten five or six times: then hadst thou smitten Syria till thou hadst consumed it; whereas now thou shalt smite Syria but thrice.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pathien mi chu a chunga chun a lunginsen tah a, “Vawi nga, vawi ruk lai i sun ding i sawnnaw; chuongchun, Suria mihai chu bo- hmang dêr khawpin i hne ding a nih. Amiruokchu, Suria mihai chu vawi thum chau i hne ding a ni ta hi,” a ta.

en: And Elisha died, and they buried him. Now the bands of the Moabites invaded the land at the coming in of the year.
hmr: Chun, Elisa chu a thih a, an phûm tah a. Chun, kum a hung invawi po hin, Moab mihai chun an ram hi an hung rûn hlak a.

en: And it came to pass, as they were burying a man, that, behold, they spied a band; and they cast the man into the sepulchre of Elisha: and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat an phûm ding lai takin, ngai ta, pâwl pakhat an hei hmuh a; chuongchun, ama chu Elisa thlâna chun an thlâk el tah a; chun, a ruong chun Elisa ruhai chu a zu tâwk phingleh, a hung hring nâwk a, a hung ngîr el tah a.

en: And Hazael king of Syria oppressed Israel all the days of Jehoahaz.
hmr: Chun, Suria lal Hazael chun Jehoahaz hun sûng chun Israelhai chu a nêksâwr zing a.

en: But Jehovah was gracious unto them, and had compassion on them, and had respect unto them, because of his covenant with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and would not destroy them, neither cast he them from his presence as yet.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, LALPAIN Ab- raham kuoma dâm, Isaak kuoma dâm, Jakob kuoma dâm khan thu a thlung leiin anni chu a lunginsiet a, a lainat a, a ngaisak a, anni chu a sukbohmang nuom nawh a, a kuoma inthawk chun a la pei thlâk nuom ta naw rawp a.

en: And Hazael king of Syria died; and Ben-hadad his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Suria lal Hazael chu a thih a, a naupa Benhadad chu ama aiaw chun ân lal tah a.

en: And Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz took again out of the hand of Ben-hadad the son of Hazael the cities which he had taken out of the hand of Jehoahaz his father by war. Three times did Joash smite him, and recovered the cities of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Jehoahaz naupa Jehoas chun Hazael naupa Benhadadin a pa Jehoahaz a rûn a, khuo a lâkpêkhai kha a lâkpêk nâwk a, Joas chun vawi thum a hneh a, Israel ram khuohai chu a lâk nâwk a.

en: In the second year of Joash son of Joahaz king of Israel began Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah to reign.
hmr: Israel lal Jehoahaz naupa Joas kum hni ân lal kum chun Juda lal Joas naupa Amazia ân lal ṭan a.

en: He was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Jehoaddin of Jerusalem.
hmr: Ân lal ṭantir chun kum sâwmhni le kum nga mi a na, Jerusalemah kum sâwmhni le kum kuo ân lal a, a nu hming chu Jehoadin, Jerusalem mi a nih.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, yet not like David his father: he did according to all that Joash his father had done.
hmr: LALPA mithmuah thil feltak a thaw hlak a, a pu David ruok chu a tluk nawh a; a pa Joas thilthaw ang po chu a thaw ve hlak a.

en: Howbeit the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
hmr: Amiruokchu, bâwlhmunhai ruok chu sukbo a ni chuong nawh; bâwl- hmunahai chun mihai chu an lân thâwiin, riminhnik an la raw zing hlak a.

en: And it came to pass, as soon as the kingdom was established in his hand, that he slew his servants who had slain the king his father:
hmr: Chun, a ram chu a hang indin nghet phingleh, a mihai a pa lal thattuhai kha a that ve thung a;

en: but the children of the murderers he put not to death; according to that which is written in the book of the law of Moses, as Jehovah commanded, saying, The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, nor the children be put to death for the fathers; but every man shall die for his own sin.
hmr: amiruokchu, chuong tuolthat- tuhai nauhai ruok chu a that nawh a; Mosie dân bua, “Nauhai leiin pahai sukhlum ding a ni nawh a, pahai leiin nauhai sukhlum ding a ni bawk nawh a, mi tin chu mâni suol leiin an thi ding a nih,” tiha LALPA thupêk dân ziek ang khan.

en: He slew of Edom in the Valley of Salt ten thousand, and took Sela by war, and called the name of it Joktheel, unto this day.
hmr: Edom mihai chu Machi Ruomah sîng khat a that a, Sela khuo chu a thawh a, a lâk a, a hming dingin Joktheel ân bûk a, tu chen hin an la ti a nih.

en: Then Amaziah sent messengers to Jehoash, the son of Jehoahaz son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, Come, let us look one another in the face.
hmr: Chuongchun, Amazia chun Israel lal Jehu naupa Jehoahaz nau Jehoas kuoma chun, “Thaw ta, hmai sanah lo inen ei tih khai,” tiin mi a tir a.

en: And Jehoash the king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, Give thy daughter to my son to wife: and there passed by a wild beast that was in Lebanon, and trod down the thistle.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal Jehoas chun, Juda lal Amazia kuomah, “Lebanon tlânga hlingin Lebanon tlânga Sidar thing kuomah ‘I naunu kha ka naupa nuhmeiah inneitir ta khai,’ tiin ân chah a; chun, Lebanon tlânga ramsa a hung a, hling chu a hung chîl thlûk dêr el tah a.

en: Thou hast indeed smitten Edom, and thy heart hath lifted thee up: glory thereof, and abide at home; for why shouldest thou meddle to thy hurt, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and Judah with thee?
hmr: Nang hin Edom mihai chu i hne ngei luoh a, i lungril a hung chapo tah a ni hi, i chapona kha intawmpui ṭawk ṭawk el rawh, nang le Juda ram puma sietna, i ta dinga thil ṭha naw ding iengdingin am i cho suok ding an leh,” tiin mi a tir veh a.

en: But Amaziah would not hear. So Jehoash king of Israel went up; and he and Amaziah king of Judah looked one another in the face at Beth-shemesh, which belongeth to Judah.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Amazia chun a lo ngai nuom nawh a. Chuongchun, Israel lal Jehoas chu a hang feh a, Juda lal Amazia le chun Juda ram Bethsemes khuoa chun hmai sanah an inen ta ngei a.

en: And Judah was put to the worse before Israel; and they fled every man to his tent.
hmr: Chun, Juda chu Israelhai hmaa chun a lo tlâwm tah a, mi tin chu mâni in tieng an fe ta seng a.

en: And Jehoash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Jehoash the son of Ahaziah, at Beth-shemesh, and came to Jerusalem, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim unto the corner gate, four hundred cubits.
hmr: Chun, Israel lal Jehoas chun Juda lal Ahazia naupa Jehoas nau Amazia chu Bethsemesa chun a man a, Jerusalem khuoah a feh a, Jeru- salem kul chu Ephraim kul kawt- khâra inthawka kul kil kawtkhâr chenin tawng za li zet a sukchim a.

en: And he took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of Jehovah, and in the treasures of the king’s house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.
hmr: Chun, LALPA ina mi le, lal ina ro siekhâwmnaa mi, rângkachak le tangka le bûr le bêlhai a um taphawt chu a lâk a, hrêna intâng dinghai leh; chun, Samari khuo tieng chun a fe nâwk tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoash which he did, and his might, and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Chuongchun, Jehoas thilthaw chanchin danghai, a thilthawthei- ziehai, Juda lal Amazia a thaw thu dâm chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua chun a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Jehoash slept with his fathers, and was buried in Samaria with the kings of Israel; and Jeroboam his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Jehoas chu a pi le puhai kuomah a in a, Samari khuoah Israel lalhai lai an phûm a; chun, a naupa Jeroboam chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: And Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Jehoash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.
hmr: Chun, Juda lal Joas naupa Amazia chu Israelhai lal Jehoahaz naupa Jehoas thi hnungin kum sâwm le kum nga a la dam a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
hmr: Chuongchun, Amazia chanchin danghai chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem; and he fled to Lachish: but they sent after him to Lachish, and slew him there.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem khuoah ama chu an phier rûk a, chuongchun, Lakis khuoah a tlân a; nisienlakhawm, Lakis khuoa chun mi an inhnawttir a, chutaka chun an that tah a.

en: And they brought him upon horses; and he was buried at Jerusalem with his fathers in the city of David.
hmr: Chun, a ruong chu sakawrin an fepui a, a pi le puhai lai David khaw- pui Jerusalema chun an phûm tah a.

en: And all the people of Judah took Azariah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the room of his father Amaziah.
hmr: Chun, Juda mi po pohaiin kum sâwm le kum ruk mi Azaria chu an ṭhuoi a, a pa Amazia aiah lalin an siem tah a.

en: He built Elath, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.
hmr: Ama chun Elath khuo chu a siemṭha nâwk a, Juda ramah an bel nâwk a, chu hnunga chun lal chu a pi le puhai kuomah a in tah a.

en: In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel began to reign in Samaria, and reigned forty and one years.
hmr: Juda lal Joas naupa Amazia kum sâwm le kum nga ân lal kum chun Israel lal Joas naupa Jeroboam chu Samari khuoah ân lal ṭan a, kum sâwmli le kum khat ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah: he departed not from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: Chun, LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a, Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a thaw Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolnahai po po kha mâksan hrim hrim a nei nawh a.

en: He restored the border of Israel from the entrance of Hamath unto the sea of the Arabah, according to the word of Jehovah, the God of Israel, which he spake by his servant Jonah the son of Amittai, the prophet, who was of Gath-hepher.
hmr: LALPA Israelhai Pathien a sie- hlaw, Gath-hepher mi Amittai naupa zâwlnei Jona hmanga a thuhril ang khan, Hamath lûtnaa inthawka Araba tuisuoriet chenin Israel ramah a bel nâwk a.

en: For Jehovah saw the affliction of Israel, that it was very bitter; for there was none shut up nor left at large, neither was there any helper for Israel.
hmr: LALPAIN Israelhai rinumzie chu a nasa êm êm a nih ti a hriet sih a; khuokhir le khir nawhai khawm an um chuong si nawh a; Israelhai ṭhangpuitu ding tukhawm an um bawk nawh.

en: And Jehovah said not that he would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven; but he saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the son of Joash.
hmr: LALPAIN Israelhai hming hi vânkhuphnuoia hin a sukchimit dêr ding a nih ti chu a lo hril naw hrim a. Joas naupa Jeroboam hmangin a sandam ta lem a nih.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his might, how he warred, and how he recovered Damascus, and Hamath, which had belonged to Judah, for Israel, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Chuongchun, Jeroboam chan- chin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai, a thilthawtheizie dâm, a râl do thu dâm, kha hmaa Juda ram chan ni hlak Damaska le Hamath khuo Israelhai ta dinga a hung lâkpêk nâwk thuhai chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Jeroboam slept with his fathers, even with the kings of Israel; and Zechariah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Jeroboam chu a pi le pu, Israel lalhai kuoma chun a in veh a; chuongchun, a naupa Zekaria chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: In the twenty and seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.
hmr: Israel lal Jeroboam kum sâwmhni le kum sari ân lal kum chun Juda lal Amazia naupa Azaria chu ân lal ṭan a.

en: Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned two and fifty years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Jecoliah of Jerusalem.
hmr: An lal ṭantir chun ama chu kum sâwm le kum ruk mi a na. Jerusalem- a chun kum sâwmnga le kum hni ân lal a; a nu hming chu Jekolia, Jeru- salem mi a nih.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.
hmr: Chun, a pa Amazia thilthaw ang po thaw vein, LALPA mithmuah thil ṭhatak a thaw hlak a.

en: Howbeit the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.
hmr: Amiruokchu, bâwlhmunhai chu sukbo a ni chuong nawh, bâwlhmun- ahai chun mihai chu an lân thâwiin, riminhnik an la raw zing hlak.

en: And Jehovah smote the king, so that he was a leper unto the day of his death, and dwelt in a separate house. And Jotham the king’s son was over the household, judging the people of the land.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN lal chu a hung hrem tah a, chuongchun, a thi ni chen chun ân phâr a, in tumah a um tah a. Chun, lal naupa Jotham chu an rama mihai rorêlpêkin insûng tieng hotuah a um tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
hmr: Chuongchun, Azaria chanchin dang a thilthawhai po po chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Azariah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David: and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Azaria chu a pi le puhai lai David khawpuia chun an phûm a; chun, a naupa Jotham chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: In the thirty and eighth year of Azariah king of Judah did Zechariah the son of Jeroboam reign over Israel in Samaria six months.
hmr: Juda lal Azaria kum sâwmthum le kum riet ân lal kum chun Jeroboam naupa Zekaria chu Israelhai chung- ah Samari khuoah thla ruk sûng ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, as his fathers had done: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: Chun, a puhai thaw ang bawk, LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a; Israelhai thil insuksuol- tira a thaw Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolnahai kha a mâksan nawh.

en: And Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and smote him before the people, and slew him, and reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Jabes naupa Sallum chun ama a phier rûk a, mipuihai hmaa chun a thawh a, a that a, a aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Zechariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
hmr: Chun, Zekaria chanchin dang- hai chu, ngai ta, Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua chun a chuong a nih.

en: This was the word of Jehovah which he spake unto Jehu, saying, Thy sons to the fourth generation shall sit upon the throne of Israel. And so it came to pass.
hmr: Chu chu LALPAIN Jehu kuom- ah, “I naupasalhai chu suon lina chenin Israelhai lalṭhungphaah ṭhung an tih,” ti thu a hril kha a nih. Chuongchun, chuong ang tak chu a hung ni ta hrim a.

en: Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the nine and thirtieth year of Uzziah king of Judah; and he reigned the space of a month in Samaria.
hmr: Juda lal Uzzia kum sâwmthum le kum kuo ân lal kum chun Jabes naupa Sallum chu ân lal ṭan a; Samari khuoah thla khat sûng ân lal a.

en: And Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and smote Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria, and slew him, and reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Gadi naupa Menahem chu Tirza khuoa inthawkin a hang feh a, Samari khuoah a feh a; Jabes naupa Sallum chu Samari khuoa chun a thawh a, a that a, a aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Sallum chanchin danghai, a phier rûkna thuhai chu, ngai ta, Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a nih.

en: Then Menahem smote Tiphsah, and all that were therein, and the borders thereof, from Tirzah: because they opened not to him, therefore he smote it; and all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.
hmr: Chuongchun, Menahem chun Tirzaa inthawk chun Tipsa khuo le a sûnga um po pohai le a ramhai chu a thawh a, an inhawng naw leiin a do a nih; chuonga nau vawnlai nuhmeihai po po chu a phirthlêr a.

en: In the nine and thirtieth year of Azariah king of Judah began Menahem the son of Gadi to reign over Israel, and reigned ten years in Samaria.
hmr: Juda lal Azaria kum sâwmthum le kum kuo ân lal kum chun Gadi naupa Menahem chu Israelhai chungah ân lal ṭan a; Samari khuoah kum sâwm ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah: he departed not all his days from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: Chun, LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a; Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a thaw Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolnahai kha a dam sûngin a mâksan nawh.

en: There came against the land Pul the king of Assyria; and Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver, that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.
hmr: Assuria lal Pula chun an ram chu a hung thawh a; ram chu a nei nghetpui theina dingin Menahem chun Pula chu tangka talent sâng a pêk a.

en: And Menahem exacted the money of Israel, even of all the mighty men of wealth, of each man fifty shekels of silver, to give to the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria turned back, and stayed not there in the land.
hmr: Chun, Menahem chun Assuria lal pêk dingin Israel mi neinunghai po poa inthawk chun tangka shekel sâwmnga seng a dâwl a. Chuong- chun, Assuria lal chu a kîr nâwk tah a, chu rama chun a um zing nawh a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?
hmr: Chuongchun, Menahem chan- chin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai chu Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Menahem slept with his fathers; and Pekahiah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Menahem chu a pi le puhai kuomah a in veh a; chun, a naupa Pekahia chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned two years.
hmr: Juda lal Azaria kum sâwmnga ân lal kum chun Menahem naupa Pekahia chu Israelhai chungah Samari khuoah ân lal ṭan a, kum hni sûng ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a; Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a thaw Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolnahai kha a mâksan nawh.

en: And Pekah the son of Remaliah, his captain, conspired against him, and smote him in Samaria, in the castle of the king’s house, with Argob and Arieh; and with him were fifty men of the Gileadites: and he slew him, and reigned in his stead.
hmr: A sipai hotu Remalia naupa Pekain ama chu a phier rûk a, Samari khuoa lal ina kulah Argob leh Arie le chun a that a; a kuoma chun Gilead mi sâwmnga an um veh a; chuong- chun, Pekahia chu a that a, a aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pekahia chanchin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai chu, ngai ta, Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua chun a chuong a nih.

en: In the two and fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekah the son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned twenty years.
hmr: Juda lal Azaria kum sâwmnga le kum hni ân lal kum chun Remalia naupa Peka chu Israelhai chungah Samari khuoa chun ân lal ṭan a; kum sâwmhni ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin.
hmr: Chun, LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a; Israelhai thil insuksuoltira a thaw Nebat naupa Jeroboam suolnahai kha a mâksan nawh.

en: In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abel-beth-maacah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali; and he carried them captive to Assyria.
hmr: Israel lal Peka inlal laiin Assuria lal Tiglath-pileser chun Ijon khuo dâm, Abel-beth-maaka khuo dâm, Janoa khuo dâm, Kedes khuo dâm, Hazor khuo dâm, Gilead le Galili ram dâm, Naphtali ram po po chu a lâk a; chun, Assuria rama chun salah a ṭhuoi a.

en: And Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah, and smote him, and slew him, and reigned in his stead, in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.
hmr: Chun, Ela naupa Hosea chun Remalia naupa Peka chu a phier rûk a, a thawh a, a that a. Uzzia naupa Jotham kum sâwmhni ân lal kum chun a aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Pekah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Peka chanchin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai chu, ngai ta, Israel lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna bua chun a chuong a nih.

en: In the second year of Pekah the son of Remaliah king of Israel began Jotham the son of Uzziah king of Judah to reign.
hmr: Israel lal Remalia naupa Peka kum hni ân lal kum chun Juda lal Uzzia naupa Jotham chu ân lal ṭan a.

en: Five and twenty years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and his mother’s name was Jerusha the daughter of Zadok.
hmr: Ân lal ṭantir chun kum sâwm- hni le kum nga mi a na; Jerusalemah kum sâwm le kum ruk ân lal a; a nu hming chu Jerusa, Zadok naunu a nih.

en: And he did that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah; he did according to all that his father Uzziah had done.
hmr: Chun, a pa Uzzia thilthaw ang po thaw vein; LALPA mithmuah thil ṭhatak a thaw hlak a.

en: Howbeit the high places were not taken away: the people still sacrificed and burned incense in the high places. He built the upper gate of the house of Jehovah.
hmr: Amiruokchu, bâwlhmunhai chu sukbo a ni chuong nawh; bâwl- hmunahai chun mihai chu an lân thâwiin, rim inhnik an la raw zing hlak. LALPA in kawtkhâr sakhnung lem chu a siemṭhah a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
hmr: Chuongchun, Jotham chanchin danghai, a thilthaw po pohai chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: In those days Jehovah began to send against Judah Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Suria lal Rezin le, Remalia naupa Peka chu Juda- hai thaw dingin LALPAIN a tir ṭan tah a.

en: And Jotham slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Jotham chu a pi le puhai kuomah a in tah a, a pi le puhai lai a pu David khawpuia chun an phûm tah a, a naupa Ahaz chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.
hmr: Remalia naupa Peka kum sâwm le kum sari ân lal kum chun Juda lal Jotham naupa Ahaz chu ân lal ṭan a.

en: Twenty years old was Ahaz when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and he did not that which was right in the eyes of Jehovah his God, like David his father.
hmr: Ahaz chu ân lal ṭantirin kum sâwmhni mi a nih; chun, Jerusalem- ah kum sâwm le kum ruk ân lal a. A pu David angin LALPA a Pathien mithmuah thil ṭhatak a thaw ve nawh a.

en: But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, yea, and made his son to pass through the fire, according to the abominations of the nations, whom Jehovah cast out from before the children of Israel.
hmr: Israel lalhai lampui hraw chu a hraw veh a, anih, LALPAIN Israel thlahai hmaa a hnawtsuok hnam- haiin thil tirdakumtak an thaw hlak angin a naupa chu meiah ân lûttir a.

en: And he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.
hmr: Chun, bâwlhmunahai, tlângahai, thing hring hmun tin hnuoia dâm ân thâwi a, riminhnik a rawh a.

en: Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war: and they besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Suria lal Rezin le Israel lal Remalia naupa Peka chu Jerusalem thaw dingin an hang feh a; Ahaz chu an hang inhuol a, nisien- lakhawm, an hne thei nawh a.

en: At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath to Syria, and drove the Jews from Elath; and the Syrians came to Elath, and dwelt there, unto this day.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Suria lal Rezin chun Elath khuo chu Suria rama dingin a lâk nâwk a, Judahai chu Elath khuoa inthawk chun a hnawt- suok a; chun, Suria mihai chun Elath khuo chu an va hluo a, tu chen hin an la um zing a nih.

en: So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, saying, I am thy servant and thy son: come up, and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria, and out of the hand of the king of Israel, who rise up against me.
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahaz chun Assuria lal Tiglath-pileser kuomah, “I siehlaw le i naupa ka ni annâwm, a mi thaw dinga hung inthawk, Suria lal kuta inthawk le Israel lal kuta inthawk hin mi hang sansuok ta khai,” tiin mi a tir a.

en: And Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in the house of Jehovah, and in the treasures of the king’s house, and sent it for a present to the king of Assyria.
hmr: Chun, Ahaz chun LALPA ina tangka le rângkachak um taphawt chu lal ina ro siekhâwmnaa mi leh a lâk a, Assuria lal kuomah lâwmman dingin a thawn a.

en: And the king of Assyria hearkened unto him; and the king of Assyria went up against Damascus, and took it, and carried the people of it captive to Kir, and slew Rezin.
hmr: Chun, Assuria lal chun a thuhril chu a lo zâwm a; chuongchun, Assuria lal chun Damaska khuo chu a hang thawh a, a lâk a, a mihai chu Kir ramah salah a ṭhuoi a, Rezin chu a that a.

en: And king Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, and saw the altar that was at Damascus; and king Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest the fashion of the altar, and the pattern of it, according to all the workmanship thereof.
hmr: Chun, lal Ahaz chu Assuria lal Tiglath-pileser be dingin Damaska khuoah a feh a, Damaska khuoa mâichâm chu a va hmuh a; chuong- chun, lal Ahaz chun chu mâichâm lim le an siem dân ang chiea enkhi dingin thiempu Urija kuomah ân phur a.

en: And Urijah the priest built an altar: according to all that king Ahaz had sent from Damascus, so did Urijah the priest make it against the coming of king Ahaz from Damascus.
hmr: Chun, thiempu Urija chun mâi- châm a hang siem a; lal Ahazin Damaska khuoa inthawka a thawn ang chie chun thiempu Urija chun Damaska khuoa inthawka lal Ahaz hung hma chun a lo siem hman diem a.

en: And when the king was come from Damascus, the king saw the altar: and the king drew near unto the altar, and offered thereon.
hmr: Chun, Damaska khuoa in- thawka lal a hung tlung chun lal chun mâichâm chu a hei hmuh a; chun, lal chun mâichâm chu a pan hnai a, a hang lâwn a.

en: And he burnt his burnt-offering and his meal-offering, and poured his drink-offering, and sprinkled the blood of his peace-offerings, upon the altar.
hmr: Chun, mâichâma chun a pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai rawin a beiphit thilinhlânhai chu ân hlân a; a dâwn ding thilinhlân chu a buok a, ân remna thilinhlân thisen chu a the bawk a.

en: And the brazen altar, which was before Jehovah, he brought from the forefront of the house, from between his altar and the house of Jehovah, and put it on the north side of his altar.
hmr: Chun, LALPA hmaa dâr mâi- châm, a mâichâm le LALPA in inkâra mi, in hmazâwna mi chu a lâk sawn a, a mâichâm hmâr tieng panga chun a sie tah a.

en: And king Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest, saying, Upon the great altar burn the morning burnt-offering, and the evening meal-offering, and the king’s burnt-offering, and his meal-offering, with the burnt-offering of all the people of the land, and their meal-offering, and their drink-offerings; and sprinkle upon it all the blood of the burnt-offering, and all the blood of the sacrifice: but the brazen altar shall be for me to inquire by.
hmr: Chun, lal Ahaz chun, “Mâichâm lientaka hin zingtienga pumraw- hmang thilinhlânhai, zântienga bei- phit thilinhlân dâm, lal pumraw- hmang thilinhlân dâm, a beiphit thilinhlân dâm, a ram mipui po po pumrawhmang thilinhlân dâm, an beiphit thilinhlân dâm, an dâwn ding thilinhlân dâm le hin inhlânin raw la; chun, a chunga chun pumrawhmang thilinhlân thisen po po le, inthâwina thisen po po chu the rawh, dâr mâichâm ruok chu ka biekna ding ning a ta,” tiin thiempu Urija chu thu a pêk a.

en: Thus did Urijah the priest, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiempu Urija chun lal Ahaz thupêk ang po po chun a thaw tah a.

en: And king Ahaz cut off the panels of the bases, and removed the laver from off them, and took down the sea from off the brazen oxen that were under it, and put it upon a pavement of stone.
hmr: Chun, lal Ahaz chun inṭhutna khurhai chu a suksiet a, insâwpna bêl chu a sie sawn a; ân ṭhutna dâr bâwngchalhaia inthawk dâm chun tuizêng chu a lâk thlâk a, lungrem chungah ân ṭhut a.

en: And the covered way for the sabbath that they had built in the house, and the king’s entry without, turned he unto the house of Jehovah, because of the king of Assyria.
hmr: Chun, châwl nia dinga chung neia lampui ina an siem le tuoltienga lal lûtna chu Assuria lal lei chun LALPA in dingin a thlâkthleng ta hlau a.

en: Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
hmr: Chuongchun, Ahaz thilthaw chanchin danghai chu Juda lalhai inlal lai thu ziekna buah a chuong a ni naw am a nih?

en: And Ahaz slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.
hmr: Chun, Ahaz chu a pi le puhai kuomah a in a; a pi le puhai lai David khawpuia chun an phûm tah a; chun, a naupa Hezekia chu ama aiawin ân lal tah a.

en: In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah began Hoshea the son of Elah to reign in Samaria over Israel, and reigned nine years.
hmr: Juda lal Ahaz kum sâwm le kum hni ân lal kum chun Ela naupa Hosea chu Israelhai chungah Samari khuoa chun ân lal ṭan a; kum kuo ân lal a.

en: And he did that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, yet not as the kings of Israel that were before him.
hmr: Chun, LALPA mithmuah thil ṭha nawtak a thaw hlak a, amiruokchu, a hmaa Israel lalhai ang êm chun chu a thaw nawh a.

en: Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant, and brought him tribute.
hmr: Assuria lal Salmaneserin a hang rûn a; chuongchun, Hosea chu a sie- hlawah a um tah a, sie dâm a pêk hlak a.

en: And the king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea; for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt, and offered no tribute to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year: therefore the king of Assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.
hmr: Chun, Assuria lal chun Hosea in a phier rûk thu a lo hriet a, Aigupta lal So kuomah mi a tir bawk a, kum tina a pêk hlak ang khan Assuria lal chu sie chu a pêk ta bawk si nawh a; chuleiin, Assuria lal chun intângna inah khuop pumin a khum tah a.

en: Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land, and went up to Samaria, and besieged it three years.
hmr: Chuongchun, Assuria lal chun ram po po chu a hrût suok vawng a, Samari khuoa chun a hang feh a, kum thum sûng ân huol a.

en: In the ninth year of Hoshea the king of Assyria took Samaria, and carried Israel away unto Assyria, and placed them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.
hmr: Hosea kum kuo ân lal kum chun Assuria lal chun Samari khuo chu a lâk a, Israel mihai chu Assuria rama chun a ṭhuoi a, Hala rama dâm, Gozan rama Habor vadunga dâm, Media mihai khuoa dâm ân umtir a.

en: And it was so, because the children of Israel had sinned against Jehovah their God, who brought them up out of the land of Egypt from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and had feared other gods,
hmr: Chuong anga an umna san chu Israel thlahai chun Aigupta lal Pharao kuta inthawkin, Aigupta rama inthawka ṭhuoi suoktu LALPA an Pathien chungah thil an suksuol a, pathien danghai an pawisa lem a,

en: and walked in the statutes of the nations, whom Jehovah cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel, which they made.
hmr: LALPAIN Israel thlahai hmaa a lo hnawt suok tah hnamhai thuruot le Israel lalhai thuruot anga an lo pawm tâk lei a nih.

en: And the children of Israel did secretly things that were not right against Jehovah their God: and they built them high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city;
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chun LALPA an Pathien chunga chun thil ṭha nawtak inrûkin an thaw hlak a, an khuo po poah râl vêngtuhai in insânga inthawka kul nei khuo chenin bâwlhmunhai an siem a.

en: and they set them up pillars and Asherim upon every high hill, and under every green tree;
hmr: Tlâng insâng tina le thing hring tin hnuoia hin lungphunhai phunin Asera dâm an siem a,

en: and there they burnt incense in all the high places, as did the nations whom Jehovah carried away before them; and they wrought wicked things to provoke Jehovah to anger;
hmr: chuong bâwlhmunhai po poa chun LALPAIN an hmaa a hnawt hmang tahai thaw dân ang khan riminhnikhai an raw hlak a; LALPA suklungsenna dingin thil suoltak an thaw bawk hlak a.

en: and they served idols, whereof Jehovah had said unto them, Ye shall not do this thing.
hmr: LALPAIN an kuoma, “Hieng ang hi thaw naw ro,” a ti milimhai rawng an bâwl bawk hlak a.

en: Yet Jehovah testified unto Israel, and unto Judah, by every prophet, and every seer, saying, Turn ye from your evil ways, and keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers, and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.
hmr: LALPA chun, “Dân zâwm ding in pi le puhai ka pêk le ka siehlaw zâwlneihai hmanga kân hriettir ang pei cheu chun, in umdân suol hi nghatsan unla, ka thupêkhai le ka thuruothai chu pawm ro,” tiin Israel- hai le Judahai chu zâwlnei tin le hmutheitu tinhai chu hmangin ân hriettir hlak a.

en: Notwithstanding, they would not hear, but hardened their neck, like to the neck of their fathers, who believed not in Jehovah their God.
hmr: Chuong sa khawm chun an pawm nuom nawh a, an pi le pu, LALPA an Pathien ring nuom naw- haiin an lûlul an insuo angin an lûlul an insuo veh a.

en: And they rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified unto them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and went after the nations that were round about them, concerning whom Jehovah had charged them that they should not do like them.
hmr: Chun, a thuruothai, an pi le puhai kuoma a thuthlunghai, an kuoma thu inhriettirhai chu an pawisa nuom nawh a; thil teplo mei mei an pawm a, teplo mei mei an hung ni tah a; an chungchâng thua LALPAIN, “Anni ang chun thaw naw ro,” a lo ti tah, an kâwl vêla hnamhai thaw dân chu an lâk veh a.

en: And they forsook all the commandments of Jehovah their God, and made them molten images, even two calves, and made an Asherah, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served Baal.
hmr: Chun, LALPA an Pathien thu- pêk po pohai chu an nghatsan a, bâwngtê lim sung pahni an siem a; chun, Asera an siem a, vâna um po po khi an biek a, Baal rawng an bâwl hlak.

en: And they caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire, and used divination and enchantments, and sold themselves to do that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah, to provoke him to anger.
hmr: Chun, an naupasalhai le an naunuhmeihai chu meiah an inlûttir a, aisân le dawi dâm an chîng a,LALPA suklungsenna dingin a mithmua thil ṭha nawtak thaw dingin an inzawr a.

en: Therefore Jehovah was very angry with Israel, and removed them out of his sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA chu Israelhai chunga chun a lung a sen ta êm êm a, a mithmu phâk nawah a sawn hmang dai tah a; Juda hnam chau naw chu um an um ta nawh a.

en: Also Judah kept not the commandments of Jehovah their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.
hmr: Judahai khawm chun LALPA an Pathien thupêkhai chu an zâwm nawh a, Israelhaiin an pawm thu- ruothai ang chun an um lem a.

en: And Jehovah rejected all the seed of Israel, and afflicted them, and delivered them into the hand of spoilers, until he had cast them out of his sight.
hmr: Chun, LALPAIN Israel thlahai hrim hrim chu a dit ta nawh a, anni chu a sukrimsih a, a mit hmu phâk nawa a sawn hmang hma po chun rawktuhai kuta chun a pêk tah a.

en: For he rent Israel from the house of David; and they made Jeroboam the son of Nebat king: and Jeroboam drove Israel from following Jehovah, and made them sin a great sin.
hmr: Israelhai chu David sûnghai an nina chu a peipêk tah a, chuongchun, Nebat naupa Jeroboam kha lal dingin an siem a, chun, Jeroboam chun Israelhaiin LALPA an zui chu a lo kuoipêt a, thil suol nasatak ân thawtir a.

en: And the children of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he did; they departed not from them;
hmr: Chun, Israel thlahai chun Jeroboam thil suksuolna ang po po chu an thaw veh a, an mâksan ngai hrim hrim nawh a,

en: until Jehovah removed Israel out of his sight, as he spake by all his servants the prophets. So Israel was carried away out of their own land to Assyria unto this day.
hmr: chuonghai chu LALPAIN a zâwlneihai po po hmanga a lo hril ta anga anni chu a mithmu phâk nawa a sawn hmang hmakhat khan chu. Chuongchun, Israelhai chu an rama inthawkin Assuria ramah an ṭhuoi tah a, tu chen hin chutaka chun an la um ta zing a nih.

en: And the king of Assyria brought men from Babylon, and from Cuthah, and from Avva, and from Hamath and Sepharvaim, and placed them in the cities of Samaria instead of the children of Israel; and they possessed Samaria, and dwelt in the cities thereof.
